text: Elizabeth Ruth (born 1968) is a Canadian novelist. ==Early life and education== Ruth was born in Windsor, Ontario, was raised by a single mother, and lived in the United States, Canada, and Colombia while growing up. Ruth earned an Honours BA and an MA from the University of Toronto. ==Career== Before becoming a published writer, she worked in social services in Ontario and British Columbia. Her debut novel, Ten Good Seconds of Silence, was nominated for the Rogers Writers' Trust Fiction Prize, the Books in Canada First Novel Award and the City of Toronto Book Award in 2001. Her second novel, Smoke, was published in 2005. Openly lesbian, Ruth also organized a monthly reading series, "Clit Lit", for lesbian writers in Toronto. ==Works== ===Fiction=== *Ten Good Seconds of Silence (2001) *Smoke (2005) *Matadora (2013) *Love You to Death (2013) *To Be Gone ===Anthologies=== *Bent on Writing: Contemporary Queer Tales (2002, ed.) == References == ==External links== * Elizabeth Ruth Category:1968 births Category:Canadian emigrants to the United States Category:Canadian women novelists Category:Living people Category:LGBT writers from Canada Category:Writers from Toronto Category:Writers from Windsor, Ontario Category:University of Toronto alumni Category:21st-century Canadian novelists Category:LGBT novelists Category:21st-century Canadian women writers
